title: AssetDump v2 Core Definitions
description: Shared schema fragments reused across AssetDump v2 Facts, Relations, Indexes and Metrics documents.
$comment: Shared definitions for AssetDump v2. All reusable schemas must live under $defs so validators discover them.

CollectionID.description: Stable identifier for a serialized collection (e.g., sharedassets1.assets, BUILTIN-EXTRA). The reserved value 'MISSING' indicates an unresolved collection reference.

StableKey.description: Deterministic key '<collectionId>:<pathId>' used for lexicographic (dictionary order) indexing and sorting. Ensures consistent ordering across exports.

Timestamp.description: UTC timestamp in extended ISO-8601 form (e.g., 2025-11-02T13:30:00Z).

UnityGuid.description: Unity GUID in 32 hex characters (no dashes) or canonical GUID format (with dashes). Used for scene references and asset identification.

CompressionCodec.description: Supported compression codecs for AssetDump shards.

AssetPK.description: Primary key structure for Unity assets. Combines collection identifier with PathID to create a globally unique asset reference.

pathId.description: Unity m_PathID that uniquely identifies an object inside the owning collection. Corresponds to IUnityObjectBase.PathID.

AssetRef.description: Structured reference to a Unity asset using collectionId + pathId. Corresponds to Unity's PPtr (Pointer) structure for cross-file asset references.

pathId.description: Unity m_PathID within the referenced collection.

NullableAssetRef.description: Optional Unity asset reference; null denotes unresolved or intentionally empty edges. Corresponds to Unity's null PPtr (FileID=0, PathID=0).

BundleRef.description: Reference to a Bundle node using stable PK. Bundles represent container structures in AssetRipper's hierarchy (GameBundle, ProcessedBundle, etc.).

bundlePk.description: Stable 8-character hex identifier for the bundle node, derived from its hierarchical lineage path.

bundleName.description: Optional human-readable bundle name for readability.

SceneRef.description: Reference to a Scene using Unity GUID. GUID is the primary key as it's unique across the entire project.

sceneName.description: Optional scene name for human readability.

HierarchyPath.description: Complete hierarchical path from root to target entity. Represents the full Bundle nesting structure in AssetRipper.

bundlePath.description: Ordered list of bundle PKs from root to current bundle. First element is always the root GameBundle.

bundleNames.description: Human-readable bundle names corresponding to bundlePath. Array length must match bundlePath.

depth.description: Hierarchy depth where root = 0. Equals bundlePath.length - 1.
